insecure.description: Allow insecure HTTPS client. This can also be set as the NXOS_INSECURE environment variable. Defaults to `true`.

password.description: Password for the NXOS device account. This can also be set as the NXOS_PASSWORD environment variable.

retries.description: Number of retries for REST API calls. This can also be set as the NXOS_RETRIES environment variable. Defaults to `3`.

url.description: URL of the Cisco NXOS device. This can also be set as the NXOS_URL environment variable.

username.description: Username for the NXOS device account. This can also be set as the NXOS_USERNAME environment variable.

class_name.description: Which class object is being created. (Make sure there is no colon in the classname)

content.description: Map of key-value pairs that need to be passed to the Model object as parameters.

dn.description: Distinguished name of object being managed including its relative name, e.g. sys/intf/phys-[eth1/1].

id.description: The distinguished name of the object.

block.description: Manages NXOS Model Objects via REST API calls. This resource can only manage a single API object. It is able to read the state and therefore reconcile configuration drift.

class_name.description: Class name of object being retrieved.

content.description: Map of key-value pairs which represents the attributes of object being retrieved.

dn.description: Distinguished name of object to be retrieved, e.g. sys/intf/phys-[eth1/1].

id.description: The distinguished name of the object.

block.description: This data source can read one NXOS object.
